name: Hero of the Kingdom II
description: You and your sister had finally found a haven in a small fishing village when you encountered more troubles. An unstoppable pirate crew threatened the entire kingdom. Your sister was kidnapped and taken to lands unknown. You must embark on a journey to the end of the world to save her.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP, Vista, 7, 8, 10 Processor: 1.0 GHz Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: 128 MB, DirectX 9.0 DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 460 MB available space Additional Notes: Mouse or touch control

reviews.review_text: YES! It's finally here. Been waiting for this from a loooooong time!  + The biggest 'PRO' of this game is that it's  EXTREMELY FUN  to play. It's relaxing, soothing, immerse, and most of all FUN.  +  Awesome Story : It's about how a common village boy struggles to save his sister and along the journey helps everyone he meets.  +  Casual, Fun, Relaxing : This is not a super hardcore game, just a casual one which will make you smile and happy! ;)  +  World, Environment, Aesthetics : The graphics may not be top-notch, but the aesthetics are awesome! You are really transported into another world. You can feel the stuff happening around you, you actually start believing that you are the protagonist.  +  Unique gameplay : It's purely point and click, but it's not like your common hidden object game either. It mixes hidden object, strategy, decision-making and RPG elements into one single combo and trust me.. it's worth trying.  +  NON-LINEAR : Unlike the first one, there's a plethora of things to do and a plethora of ways to do it. You'll have to make many smart choices as to how to proceed. I don't think it's possible to get stuck, but the game might get extremely slow if you keep on making bad choices.  Â±  Sountrack : The soundtrack is amazing. But it's pretty much exactly the same as the first game. I was hoping for a little change/variety.  - There are *SOME* objects which are very tough to find, and it can get frustrating very quickly. But if it does, you can always ask it on the discussions page and we will be happy to help!  - There's one more problem with the game. There are several skills which are unlocked later but it is very likely that you will do things and never know why you did them.   I killed tons of spiders and zombies to reach nothing but dead ends and no award. I kind of started thinking it was just a way to make me lose my gold until I unlocked the lock-picking skill after which it all made sense. Maybe a marker on locked objects stating you need to learn how to unlock would have made me less furious.    This game is built on the same engine as the First one, except that it has some better animations/bigger sprites and support for different profiles/save games.    Be sure to check out my  review  of the first part to get a rough idea about what you can expect.   Rating: 9/10 I subtracted a point from the original because of some more cons in the game. But added a point for an overall more non-linear gameplay.

This game is truly captivating and delightful! Just like the first installment, you go around solving problems and completing quests for the people you meet in return for their help that ultimately leads to you rescuing your sister who has been kidnapped by pirates. By completing quests you gain fame points, which mark your advancement in game.   The story is great. It's one of those stories you were read to as a child or told by your grandfather. The music is very soothing and only adds to the calm athmospere of the game. The scenery is breathtaking and the searchable items are not as tiny as in the first game, thus easier to find.   I have finished the game an hour ago and I am already experiencing serious withdrawal. 10/10

I cant wait for hero the Kingdom III! This is a point & click games with strategic resource management & progressive hidden object content. This game is good as its predecessor. It begins with.that pirates capture the maincharacters sister & then you have the mission to find her,during it you will have many sidequests.  +good story +calm game +easy archivements +no frustrating +uncomplicated control(easy to handle) +looks like an rpg +clear game +is addicting  -too short  Buy it if you enjoy point & click games!  btw: I got it very cheap, so it was almost for free.

Just like its first part this game is a fun to play point and click game, although I completed it really fast. It took me 4,5 hours to get to the end, then I went for the achievements and also completed them very fast as you can see.   In the first part it was just a small world to explore if you compare it to this one. It took me more time to learn all the skills, so I had to go several times to the same place, first to pick mushrooms, then to find eggs etc. Just before the end, when I got achievements for finding a lot of eggs, and killing lots of wild animals, I noticed that when I got the master achievement, there still were some eggs to find (probably other stuff too, but I noticed the eggs). In the first part, when you got the master achievement there weren't any eggs left, so that's a little change. Nice for when you're short on money.  The whole map was used in a nice way, land above and islands below. The storyline was a bit better than the first one in which you had to defeat an evil wizard to save the kingdom. This time I had to find my sister, I found her and also my brother who left a long time ago, but got possessed by the devil and became a pirate because of that. Then I got a wizard by my side and had to defeat that devil and its creatures.  As opposed to the first part it was a lot harder to obtain the items needed, because during the first part I created the habit of selling almost everything I had, since I wasn't going to use it anymore. Due to that 'bad' habit I often had money problems during important (and expensive) missions, but I made it!  Just as its first part it's just a game to play when you have spare time and you don't know what to do with it. Also perfect for the beginning achievement hunter.

Basically the same thing as the first game, with new, separate story going on. If you liked the other game, you already know how it goes and sure, why not another!  This is a simple, relaxing, point-click (more in the vein of cow clickers) / pixel hunt adventure game. Will not blow your socks clean off but you gotta like it (VERY simple gameplay though so if you want any challenge this is not for you)

I really liked playing   Hero of the Kingdom II  ! It's a fun, but short adventure RPG, where you have to help people by collecting resources. The main goal of the game is to rescue your sister kidnapped by pirates by building a boat and search for the island where she is. I have had 7.6 hours of fun playing   Hero of the Kingdom II   and I definitely recommend this game if you want to relax and have fun!

Hero of the Kingdom II is a very casual and relaxed game. There's no stress, no time limits and no 'action' to speak of. It's entirely based around economic puzzles; gathering resources in many forms and bringing them together to progress. Some you need to spend, others stay with you. It's simple enough, with the real test being the ability to remember where and how to get what you need. For an example, remembering how to get hay when later in the game you end up needing some for a cow's bedding. -- And yes, that's about how the average quest goes. You'll be slaying monsters as well, but you do it in the exact same manner. 'Now where can I get a shield, a mercenary and a torch to slay a giant spider?'  Even then, it's fun. It's very genuinely fun. I do need to warn you that the story, writing and dialogue are all awful. Sorry! :( I don't mean that as an insult to the developer, it's just the whole world doesn't show an ounce of actual creative thinking. It's a cookie-cutter save-the-girl quest in a cookie-cutter fantasy kingdom in which you face cookie-cutter pirates. If you want a story, avoid this game like the plague. If you want a chill, casual, resource-driven puzzle game, dude, go nuts. It's totally worth it.

Good little game, probably get about 5-7hrs of gameplay out of it. A bit too much pixel hunting to get full completion, and there's a frustrating amount of going back and forth to get supplies to complete tasks, but overall quite enjoyable; entertaining story with some good aspects.  Look forward to a part 3
Beware, this game is totally addicting. Took me 7 hours to beat. Definatly gunna pick the first one up and the third when it comes out.

First of all this game is better than every way compare to the first one. Game play time (5+ hours), story, animation better that the first game and believe me, Hero of the Kingdom was and still is an awesome game. We really need more games like this. Buy this game, play and enjoy. BTW, do not forget about easy 100% achievement you will get after finish this game.
Great game. For those of you that like the first game, you will not be disappointed here. I finished the game twice, and enjoy it tremendously. It's also easy to get all the achievements too.

In the first game his father is missing. In this one his sister is missing. At some point our hero is going to have to deal with the fact that his family would rather put themselves in mortal danger rather than hang out with him for a bit..........That's gonna cost at therapy!!
Good game, waiting for a Hero of the Kingdom III...
Awesame point and click RPG game.

This game is more a standalone-addon to its predecessor than a real second part. Graphics are basically the same, UI is exactly the same, gameplay is the same, there is just a bit more of everything. A bit more to do, a bit better story, longer time to play through.  But, while I enjoyed playing the first part quite a bit, the second part does not get me. I do not know really why, but the atmosphere was much better in the first part, and this is what made me like the first part so much. But here, I find the pirate setting not as atmospheric presented as the medieval setting in the first part, the music is not as good as it was in the first part, the new 3D elements lack detail and do not fit very well in the rest of the world and you have to do a lot more jumping between the diffrent places than in the first part, which is annoying.  Maybe I'm just the sort of person who expected too much from the second part of a great first part, but I'm unfortunate to say that I cannot recommend this game to anyone who likes the first part for the same reasons I do.

Do you like pixel hunting, cliche story, lame dialogues and quests, that just may disappear while theoretically they can be still done? Go ahead and give this one a try. You can even carry workers, friends and mercenaries in your inventory. Gameplay is practically clicking on exclamation, skipping dialogue as it's not important at all, then checking the requirements to complete the quest, visit merchant, buy required stuff, go back complete the quest. That's bloody it! Why this game rating is high is beyond me, sorry this game is just too shallow for me to enjoy it.
ClichÃ© storyline, but achievements!

No clue where or why I got this. It's about as entertaining as a page of Highlights magazine. Just kinf of click things and hunt for tiny things to also click and click again. It's kind of like playing any old RPG, except with all of the strategy and puzzling and action taken out. You just click things in roughly the right order.
might aswell be a facebook game....
Never knew i would enjoy a click-game this much. 5 hours long tops but still worth the money.
Both Part One and Part two great value for money. One can't stop once you start playing. Hoping for Hero Of The Kingdom 3.
Simple, casual, RPG with some puzzle elements. You can get all achievements in game without too much difficulty. About 4-5 hours of gameplay.
Great game
PERFECT! Buy the game and enjoy fantastic story, cool gameplay and an adventure!
This game is casual, relaxing and a mixture of hidden objects/rpg/point and click adventure. A great well designed game.   The only downside is the lack of replayability.

Very similar to the first, this is a strange mix of adventure and RPG that still manages to be quite engaging. Don't play it expecting a tour de force of gaming, but do expect an enjoyable afternoon of saving the princess.
I realy enjoyed both of the Hero of the Kingdom games. A completely different take on the point and click genre, and an ejoyable experience.
Very detailed graphics, and a non-linear story line. It's not necessary to complete every quest to finish the game. I really enjoyed this and wished it were longer.
Just as fun as the origional Nice to have a hidden object game that has a storyline, and is free of in-app-purchases like most games.

So, i played HotK1 and I really enjoyed it. That's why I bought HotK2. The game really improved in story (  Yarrr pirates  ), while the gameplay stayed the same.  To the game itself: imagine a casual 2D RPG without running through empty landscapes :D The quests and riddles are simple. The gameplay is a mix of point'n'click and hidden object.  So if you want to enjoy some few hours of calm casual gaming, then this game is the right choice for you.

I love this game. After playing 51Hrs, I cannot play it again because Norton's Antivius says their is a virus in the exe file . I checked the game in steam apps and found it to be the game that has no exe file in the folder. help me to get this up and again.

Very fun and easy hidden object game: Impression after playing for hours: My mouse finger is killing me, but I just have to click one more item, one more quest giver, just one more... and then hours are lost playing this game. highly recommended.

This feels like an improvement over the first game, though when all is said and done there's very little changed other than the storyline and areas. It's an RPG without failure states where you mostly go around doing quests and clicking on small objects. The pixel hunting seems at least a little less tedious this time around, when it comes to achievements; eggs are more visible, mushrooms are quite common, though crates and barrels I did have to go and look for a bit. There's a few pixel-hunty quests too that aren't that great but ehh. I felt the storyline here was better than the last game, some plot twists, I think at least one minor character dies for real, among other things? Graphics and music are fine too. It's not a particularly deep game, but it's a fun time-waster and really surprisingly engaging. Not really something you'd pay full price for but if you can get it cheap or in a bundle then I'd say go for it. You don't have to have played the first one to be able to enjoy this one, either.

For the price i got the game at i say its worth it and maybe a bit more. The game it self was rather fun having to play the first one and now the second id say its still felt good even if it didnt change all the much. Id say its worth to get both of the games even if the time to complete them takes about from 4 to 5 hours.
It's a fun and addicting game! The only bad thing is it ending and having nothing else to do. I'll play the rest of the saga!

Basically, this game is all about clicking, trading and hidden-object hunting. If such games are your cup of tea, you'll get several hours of solid fun out of this one.  The music is relaxing, while the story is a regular save-your-captured-sister scenario with a few twists you'll experience close to the very end.  All in all, a fun little game you can play when you want to catch a break from more action-oriented and massive titles.
Fun game with simple gameplay.
